author: Special Correspondent
text:
Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK) leader Vijayakant on Friday held a closed-door meeting with party district secretaries, leading to wide speculation that he may have elicited their views on alliance for the upcoming Assembly elections.

However, party leaders were tight lipped and said the meeting involved a discussion on the preparations for the party’s public rally in Kancheepuram on February 20.

Unscheduled meeting

Sources said the meeting was an unscheduled one and lasted for an hour at the party headquarters.

Meanwhile, the DMDK began receiving applications from aspirants who want to contest the Assembly elections.

The party headquarters in Koyambedu saw a steady stream of applicants with party leader L.K. Sudhish receiving the first few applications.

Party leaders said the meeting was about preparations for a public rally at Kancheepuram
title: Vijayakant meets district secretaries
